title: Shocking moment scrap yard dealer films himself PUSHING clapped-out car with van on public road
text:
This is the shocking moment a scrap yard dealer uses his van to push a clapped-out vehicle along a public road - saying it's a 'waste of profit' to put fuel in the car.

Footage filmed by the driver shows the car being pushed along at around 50mph on the A694 heading towards Gateshead, Tyne and Wear.

The clip was posted to the page of a scrap dealer last night, but has since been removed.

Footage filmed by the driver shows the car being pushed along at around 50mph on the A694 heading towards Gateshead, Tyne and Wear

It begins with the driver pushing the vehicle, which appears to swerve from side to side, along the road - at times running close to the pavement.

The driver can be heard saying: 'Don't put fuel in a f****** scrap car. It's just a waste of profit. Push it.'

He can then be heard saying: 'Push the f*** out of the scrap yard with a truck.Don't tow it, it's illegal. Push the f*****.

'You get caught towing you get f***** - push it with a truck instead.'

The driver then pushes the car, which appears to have a colleague inside, in the bus lane and gradually speeds up to the limit.

Footage shows the driver pushing the vehicle, which appears to swerve from side to side, along the road - at times running close to the pavement

He adds 'why waste a five hour phone call and it runs out of fuel,' before a sudden burst of laughter can be heard.

One user wrote in a Facebook group that shared the video saying: 'Really not a good idea he was all over the place and could easily have spun the car in front.'

Another wrote: 'Definitely isn't legal though' followed by two laughing emojis before adding 'F****** good idea though.'

While someone else said: 'This is a level of genius I will never reach.'

Asked today if the clip was filmed on Facebook Live, the scrap yard dealer replied: 'Aye, but it doesn't mean I was driving.'

When asked why he uploaded it to Facebook he replied: 'I didn't realise it was going to get that many views as it did.'
